answers.answer: I would call your Dr or midwife. Bit in the mean time drink plenty of fluids and lay down, put your feet up above your heart.

As long as your blood pressure isnt up then its normal in your 3rd trimester im 38+1 and have had really bad swelling since last friday. To the point it hurts to walk and bend my feet and fingers even my legs swell up to my knees.

Im 39 wks and 4days, my doctor told me if my hands, arms, face, etc start to swell and they hadn't before that i should go to the hospital since it's common for ftms to have preeclampsia. Drink plenty of water and call your doc to make sure.

question: Im ftm over 40weeks pregnant. Last night i thought my water was about to break cause the baby was moving down a lot. But yeah, for the past week my hands and feet have been swollen but last night its been pretty bad to the point it hurts. What does this mean and what should i do?
title: swollen
